title: Punishment for Drugs
content:
A father caught his son with drugs, and as punishment required him to stand outside school wearing this sandwich board. Wouldn’t you be embarrassed?

[http://www.wate.com/Global/story.asp?S=6390423](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043754/http:/www.wate.com/Global/story.asp?S=6390423 "http://www.wate.com/Global/story.asp?S=6390423")

comments.content:
Not sure if I’d be more embarrassed by A) being caught, B) having my parents publicly punish me, C) having to do it outside of my school, or D) having that terrible stray lower-case _d_ in the board.

_«El futuro es una línea tan fina que apenas nos damos cuenta de pintarla nosotros mismos». (La Luz Oscura, por Javier Guerrero)_

A bit of a problem with kerning.  
Daddy obviously didn’t ask TimD’s advice.

Heh, I guess that’s a different way of punishing your kid. Social embarrassment stings exceptionally when you’re a teenager

_“We Only Get Better If We Want To”_

Thanks, Nick, for that illuminating link.

Now I realise my friends did not try to put me on drugs, they were just being civil.
Embarrassed? That’s advertising. Now the kids know who the go-to person is.
Sandwich boards are so over. Parents will soon shame their children with boardless sandwich boards, and the sandwich board designers will be out of luck.

I prefer Crack-Lite, same great taste and you don’t even have sell your TV!
